etymology.description: 对(對) (duì, "correct; facing") + 不(不) (bù, "not") + 起(起) (qǐ, "rise; begin") = not able to face -> sorry
etymology.interpretation: In this expression, 对(對) (duì, "correct; facing") suggests the idea of rightness or being accountable. When combined with 不(不) (bù, "not") and 起(起) (qǐ, "rise; begin"), it conveys a sense of being unable to face or stand up to a mistake, thus expressing remorse or apology.

examples.chinese: 我迟到了(我遲到了)，对不起(對不起)。
对不起(對不起)，请问您能再说一遍吗(請問您能再說一遍嗎)。
examples.pinyin: Duìbuqǐ, qǐngwèn nín néng zài shuō yī biàn ma.
examples.english: Sorry, may I ask you to repeat that?

examples.chinese: 妈妈误会了我(媽媽誤會了我)，对不起(對不起)。
